frequently/repeatedly

to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: They have now endured seven defeats in all competitions and there are a lot of stiff challenges still.
sentences.chinese: 他們在各項賽事中已輸掉七場，而硬仗還數不勝數。

sentences.english: Nature is full of color temperature examples.
sentences.chinese: 大自然是色溫的例子數不勝數。

sentences.english: Predictions of just such a switch have been made countless times over the years.
sentences.chinese: 這種轉變的預言多年來發生的次數數不勝數。
這樣的欺詐行爲數不勝數。

sentences.english: There are a lot of fantastic audiobooks out there.
sentences.chinese: 絕妙的有聲書數不勝數。

sentences.english: There have been many proposals, but all share two features.
sentences.chinese: 提案已然數不勝數，但總歸有兩個共同點。

sentences.english: In Silicon Valley, copyright and patent infringement suits are a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 在硅谷，侵犯版權和專利訴訟案件數不勝數。

sentences.english: There are endless possibilities on how you could configure your managed system.
sentences.chinese: 您能如何配置所管理的系統的可能性數不勝數。

definition: to shrink back/to flinch
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
in great abundance/numerous
numerous
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
top of streets, bottom of alleys (idiom); everywhere in the city
known to everybody
myriad/all kinds of/all sorts of
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
lit. as if enumerating one's family valuables (idiom)/fig. to be very familiar with a matter
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
